jde.juci
Class ConnectionImpl

java.lang.Object
  jde.juci.ConnectionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler, Connection
public class ConnectionImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler, Connection

Implementation of the JUCI Connection interface. Implements the two-way communication via a separate thread that invokes java code called from Emacs.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nick Sieger

          Creates a new ConnectionImpl instance.

 void end()
          Indicates the end of the connection's lifecycle.
 void evalBshScript(java.lang.String statement)
          Evaluate a Beanshell script statement over this connection, so that the script code can itself interact with JUCI to make calls back to Elisp.

invoke

public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object object,
                               java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                               java.lang.Object[] args)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
Implementation of dynamic proxy method invocation handing. All elisp code calling java and java code calling elisp eventually passes through this method.

Specified by:
invoke in interface java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
Parameters:
object - the proxy object being invoked
method - the method to invoke
args - method arguments
Returns:
result of method invocation
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - if an error occurs

begin

public void begin()
Description copied from interface: Connection
Indicates the start of the connection's session.

Specified by:
begin in interface Connection

end

public void end()
Description copied from interface: Connection
Indicates the end of the connection's lifecycle. Any remaining results on the connection's result stack are flushed as lisp forms for Emacs to evaluate.

Specified by:
end in interface Connection

reset

public void reset()
Description copied from interface: Connection
Reset the connection, clearing the result stack. Normally used to clean up after an error.

Specified by:
reset in interface Connection

pushResult

public void pushResult(java.lang.Object result)
Description copied from interface: Connection
Add a value to the top of the connection's result stack.

Specified by:
pushResult in interface Connection
Parameters:
result - a result to be exposed to the other side of the communication boundary

Specified by:
popResult in interface Connection
Returns:
the result at the top of the stack

peekResult

public java.lang.Object peekResult()
Description copied from interface: Connection
Examine, but don't remove, the value at the top of the connection's result stack.

Specified by:
peekResult in interface Connection
Returns:
the result at the top of the stack

setLoggerFilename

public void setLoggerFilename(java.lang.String filename)
Description copied from interface: Connection
Since standard output is used for communication between java code and Emacs, debug logging cannot be done there. With this method, a filename for logging is set and logging is turned on for the connection.

Specified by:
setLoggerFilename in interface Connection
Parameters:
filename - a log filename

evalBshScript

public void evalBshScript(java.lang.String statement)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
Description copied from interface: Connection
Evaluate a Beanshell script statement over this connection, so that the script code can itself interact with JUCI to make calls back to Elisp.

Specified by:
evalBshScript in interface Connection
Parameters:
statement - a String value
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable
